Trignometric Ratios

  1. Ratios of the sides of a right triangle with respect to its acute angles are called trigonometric ratios of the angle.
  3. In a right-angled triangle ABC, note the position of the side BC with respect to angle A. The side BC is called side opposite to angle A or perpendicular.
  4. If acute angle C is considered then with respect to C the side opposite will be AB.
  5. The trigonometric ratios of the angle A in right triangle ABC
    • sin of A = \(side\,opposite\, to\, angle A \over hypotenuse \)=\(perpendicular\over hypotenuse\)=\(BC\over AC\)
    • cos of A = \(side\, adjacent\, to \,angle A \over hypotenuse\)=\( base\over hypotenuse\)=\(AB\over AC\)
    • tan of A = \(side \,opposite\, to \,angle A \over side\, adjacent\, to\, angleA\)=\(perpendicular\over base\)=\(BC\over AB \)
    • cosec of A = \(1\over sine\,of\, A\)
    • sec of A = \(1\over cos \,of\, A\)
    • cot of A = \(1\over tan \,of\, A\)
  6. Since the hypotenuse is the longest side in a right triangle, the value of sin A or cos A is always less than or equal to 1.
